show.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
show.headline: Edgar Wright's hyper-kinetic adaptation of the cult comic

event.title: <show-title>Scott Pilgrim vs. the World</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Fourth wall-crushing epicness
event.description:
WE ARE ALAMO DRAFTHOUSE AND WE ARE HERE TO SHOW YOU AWESOME MOVIES AND HAVE FUN AND STUFF!

That’s where our SCOTT PILGRIM VS. THE WORLD Movie Party comes in. It’s a film of pure joy. An epic love letter to geek culture straight from the hearts of Edgar Wright and Bryan Lee O'Malley.

We love SCOTT PILGRIM. We love you. So in this spirit of love, we’ve brought back this epic of epicness in an epic way: with fourth wall-crushing props like a Scott Pilgrim Inflatable Bass Guitar to channel your inner Scott (or Young Neil) as you jam along to the electrifying soundtrack, a Level Up Sponge for cleaning up after making some scrummy garlic bread, and a custom double-sided "Pixelated" pressed Zinc Coin that you don’t even need to smash any evil exes to get – all included in your ticket.

It's the SCOTT PILGRIM VS. THE WORLD Movie Party and it will punch the highlights right out of your hair. Just remember, the password is “whatever”.

show.title: Dirty Dancing
show.headline: Nobody puts baby in a corner

event.title: <show-title>Dirty Dancing</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Sway along with Swayze at our interactive movie party
event.description:
When DIRTY DANCING came out in 1987, it changed lives. Baby and Johnny showed the world the power of dance, the power of love, and most importantly, the power of a shirtless and swingin' Patrick Swayze.

This film set the standard not only for dance movies but for romance in general – and more than 30 years later, we still dream of nailing that lift. And here at Alamo Drafthouse, there's no better place to celebrate Baby and Johnny, where you're encouraged to quote, sing, and dance along at this Movie Party screening. You'll also receive themed props, like your own "Staff Quarters" keychain, watermelon beach balls, and pink glow necklaces.

So, move like the wind and join us for the time of your life at Kellerman's, where absolutely no one will be put in a corner. We’ll have champagne available to order to match the effervescence on screen, and the audience is encouraged to toast, cheer, and swoon along.

contentBlocks.paragraphs: When DIRTY DANCING came out in 1987, it changed lives. Baby and Johnny showed the world the power of dance, the power of love, and most importantly, the power of a shirtless and swingin' Patrick Swayze.

event.title: <show-title>Asteroid City</show-title> <event-type-title>Advance Screening w/Livestream Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: A sneak peek & a livestream chat with Wes Anderson & out-of-this-world guests
event.description: Are you a Wes Anderson fanatic? Then you’ll definitely want to come to our exclusive ASTEROID CITY Advance Screening. It’s the only way to see his new film before anyone else. But wait, there’s more! Wes Anderson and some out-of-this-world guests will be livestreaming in for a live conversation about the film. Don’t miss this chance to learn about his new film from the man himself.

eventType.description: Catch a special screening followed by a livestreamed conversation with the actors and filmmakers.

titleCardImage.altText: Livestream QA TC

show.title: Jaws (1975)
show.headline: Steven Spielberg's terrifying creature feature

event.title: <show-title>Jaws (1975)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A bigger boatload of bite-y fun
event.description:
“This shark, swallow you whole.”

Duh, nuh…duh, nuh…nothing quite says "ah, summer" like watching an elusive giant shark terrorize Amity Island on the big screen. It’s the movie that perfected the summer blockbuster and launched a million toothy (and goofy) knock-offs, but none of them can compete with the bite of Spielberg’s 1975 original. This bona fide American classic has everything you could want from a movie: kids in peril, drunken sea shanties, and Richard Dreyfuss in a cage.

As if that wasn’t enough, this is a Movie Party, so you can live the shark-hunting adventure along with your pals Brody, Hooper, and Quint – minus the salty sea air and actual mortal peril. Featuring Shark Hats, Yellow Floatie Drink Holders (CAUTION: very susceptible to shark attacks), and other surprises, it’s the most fourth-wall-busting fun you can have on dry land.

event.title: <show-title>Asteroid City</show-title> <event-type-title>Chili Supper Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Come hungry and pull up a bowl for a down-home prix fixe menu
event.description: Calling all junior stargazers and space cadets! Join us for a night of Wes Anderson and all-American cookery at our ASTEROID CITY Chili Supper screening. We’ll be serving up a rib-sticking pre-set menu that you might find in the titular town, including chili, hot dogs, grilled cheese, themed popcorn, and drinks. Feel free to show your love of all things Anderson by dressing up as your favorite character from his films – nothing would make us happier than to see Steve Zissou and Royal Tenenbaum rub elbows while enjoying a nice bowl of homemade chili.

contentBlocks.paragraphs: Calling all junior stargazers and space cadets! Join us for a night of Wes Anderson and all-American cookery at our ASTEROID CITY Chili Supper screening. We’ll be serving up a rib-sticking pre-set menu that you might find in the titular town, including chili, hot dogs, grilled cheese, themed popcorn, and drinks. Feel free to show your love of all things Anderson by dressing up as your favorite character from his films – nothing would make us happier than to see Steve Zissou and Royal Tenenbaum rub elbows while enjoying a nice bowl of homemade chili.

show.title: Stunt Rock
show.headline: The explosive Ozploitation classic, newly restored in 4k

event.title: <show-title>Stunt Rock</show-title>
event.headline: The explosive Ozploitation classic, newly restored in 4k
event.description: STUNT ROCK is an all caps love letter to the dangerous deeds mortal men and women commit in the name of entertainment. When just diving off a cliff isn't enough, Australian stuntman extraordinaire Grant Page does it backwards...on fire. When putting on a rock concert isn't enough, bizarro hard rockers Sorcery add a magic show...and fire. In a less perfect world these things would've happened undocumented, but the action-junkie director with an eye for gorgeous photography Brian Trenchard-Smith (BMX BANDITS, MAN FROM HONG KONG) committed it all to celluloid in the quasi-documentary, quasi-concert film, total-blast STUNT ROCK. The wispy plot is just window dressing for the money shots: death-defying leaps, car chases, and a magician in a Merlin get-up shooting fireballs while a bunch of dudes with long hair pound out muscular rock music. Bring your own safety-harness, there are no nets where we're going.

show.title: By Hook or by Crook
show.headline: One of the great trans films of the 21st century

event.title: <show-title>By Hook or by Crook</show-title>
event.headline: One of the great trans films of the 21st century
event.description:
A loner from Kansas (Tribe 8 guitarist-turned-filmmaker Silas Howard) teams up with a charismatic outcast (visual and performance artist Harry Dodge) for a life of petty crime on the streets of San Francisco in this scrappy trans/butch buddy comedy, produced by veteran queer film producer Steak House. A breakout cult hit of the Sundance and SXSW film festivals that was praised by Variety as being “in the vein of Jean Genet, Jack Kerouac, and John Cassavetes,” BY HOOK OR BY CROOK is a groundbreaking portrait of brotherhood that still feels radical nearly 25 years later. (Elizabeth Purchell)

This screening will be accompanied by a prerecorded introduction and discussion with historian and programmer Elizabeth Purchell and critics Willow Catelyn Maclay and Caden Mark Gardner, coauthors of the upcoming book Corpses, Fools, and Monsters: An Examination of Trans Film Images in Cinema.

show.title: Come Back to the 5 and Dime, Jimmy Dean, Jimmy Dean
show.headline: A new DCP of Robert Altman's underrated theatrical stunner

landscapeHeroImage.altText: COME BACK TO THE 5 AND DIME, JIMMY DEAN, JIMMY DEAN

portraitHeroImage.altText: COME BACK TO THE 5 AND DIME, JIMMY DEAN, JIMMY DEAN

posterImages.altText: COME BACK TO THE 5 AND DIME, JIMMY DEAN, JIMMY DEAN

event.title: <show-title>Come Back to the 5 and Dime, Jimmy Dean, Jimmy Dean</show-title>
event.headline: A new DCP of Robert Altman's underrated theatrical stunner
event.description:
The dreams, failures, and regrets of a group of small-town Texas women are brought to light when a mysterious stranger with a shared past shows up to the 20th anniversary reunion of the Disciples of James Dean in Robert Altman’s adaptation of Ed Graczyk’s play. Featuring the entire cast of Altman’s original Broadway production of the show – including Cher, Sandy Dennis, Karen Black, Mark Patton, and Kathy Bates – and shot on its unique mirrored set, COME BACK TO THE 5 AND DIME, JIMMY DEAN, JIMMY DEAN is an overlooked gem of Altman’s '80s period and a classic tale of sisterhood. (Elizabeth Purchell)

This screening will be accompanied by a prerecorded introduction and discussion with historian and programmer Elizabeth Purchell and critics Willow Catelyn Maclay and Caden Mark Gardner, coauthors of the upcoming book Corpses, Fools, and Monsters: An Examination of Trans Film Images in Cinema.

DCP courtesy of Paramount Pictures

show.title: Dressed in Blue
show.headline: One of the best trans films you've never heard of

event.title: <show-title>Dressed in Blue</show-title>
event.headline: One of the best trans films you've never heard of
event.description:
Antonio Giménez-Rico’s landmark 1983 documentary DRESSED IN BLUE explores the lives and loves of a group of six transgender women living in Madrid in the years following Spain’s transition to democracy. A loving portrait of a culture finally emerging from the shadows after being hidden for too long, DRESSED IN BLUE is a vital testament to just how far we’ve come – and how far there’s still left to go. Never widely released in America until now, DRESSED IN BLUE is also soon to be the focus of the follow-up to the hit HBO series, VENENO. (Elizabeth Purchell)

This screening will be accompanied by a prerecorded introduction and discussion with historian and programmer Elizabeth Purchell and critics Willow Catelyn Maclay and Caden Mark Gardner, coauthors of the upcoming book Corpses, Fools, and Monsters: An Examination of Trans Film Images in Cinema.

New 2K restoration by Altered Innocence

Presented in Spanish with English subtitles

show.title: Glen or Glenda
show.headline: Edward D. Wood, Jr's seminal melodrama

event.title: <show-title>Glen or Glenda</show-title>
event.headline: Edward D. Wood, Jr's seminal melodrama
event.description:
In one of the very first films to explore transness, clean-cut Glen (writer/director Edward D. Wood, Jr. as "Daniel Davis") seemingly has everything a man could ever want: a good job, friends, and a loving fiancé (Wood’s then-girlfriend and future Elvis songwriter Dolores Fuller). But there’s a problem: there’s another woman in Glen’s life who threatens to ruin it all… himself! Famously made to cash in on the media circus surrounding Christine Jorgensen, GLEN OR GLENDA wound up being something else entirely: a nakedly personal plea for acceptance and a masterpiece of accidental avant-garde. (Elizabeth Purchell)

This screening will be accompanied by a prerecorded introduction and discussion with historian and programmer Elizabeth Purchell and critics Willow Catelyn Maclay and Caden Mark Gardner, coauthors of the upcoming book Corpses, Fools, and Monsters: An Examination of Trans Film Images in Cinema.

2K preservation by the American Genre Film Archive

show.title: Frances Ha
show.headline: Greta Gerwig follows her dwindling dreams while navigating NYC

show.title: The Return of the Living Dead
show.headline: The essential zombie splatter-massacre

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE RETURN OF THE LIVING DEAD

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE RETURN OF THE LIVING DEAD

posterImages.altText: Showpage Poster Return Of The Living Dead

event.title: <show-title>The Return of the Living Dead</show-title>
event.headline: The essential zombie splatter-massacre
event.description:
Dan O'Bannon's tongue-in-cheek sequel is a fiendishly wild send-up of the zombie genre, starring Clu Gulager and Thom Mathews as a pair of bumbling army surplus store clerks who unleash a nerve gas that reanimates corpses and sends a wave of gut-munching zombies out into the world.

Funny, smart-as-an-axe-blade, and full of outstanding performances from an ensemble cast that includes James Karen, Don Calfa, Miguel A. Núñez Jr., and Linnea Quigley, RETURN OF THE LIVING DEAD is of the greatest horror-comedies ever made.

Don't miss this brand new 4K DCP of a truly outrageous and bloody-as-hell ride.

show.title: Joy Ride
show.headline: Four friends & one very special tattoo on a raunchy journey of self-discovery

event.title: <show-title>Joy Ride</show-title> <event-type-title>Rowdy Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Hoot & holler along with the girls of Brownie Tuesday
event.description: There are some movies that just can’t be contained to our usually iron-clad no talking, no texting policy, and the debaucherous odyssey that is JOY RIDE is definitely one of them. That’s what Rowdy Screenings were made for. You and your friends are encouraged to hoot, holler, and cheer along with the girls’ raunchy exploits. Now when K-Pop legends Brownie Tuesday make their glorious debut, you can lose your mind appropriately. Just remember to keep it respectful. Our code of conduct is still in effect and disrespecting our staff or your fellow guests will not be tolerated.

eventType.title: Rowdy Screening
eventType.headline: Sometimes we hit pause on our Don’t Talk policy. This is one of those times.
eventType.description: Like a regular screening, only hoots, hollers, and cheers of all kinds are highly encouraged.

heroImage.altText: Event Category Web Hero3 Rowdy Screening 1920x1080

titleCardImage.altText: Event Category Web Hero3 Rowdy Screening 1920x1080

show.title: A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master
show.headline: Freddy returns! And he brought pizza!

landscapeHeroImage.altText: A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 4: THE DREAM MASTER

portraitHeroImage.altText: A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 4: THE DREAM MASTER

posterImages.altText: A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 4: THE DREAM MASTER

event.title: <show-title>A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master</show-title>
event.headline: Freddy returns in 35mm! And he brought pizza!
event.description: Where does the world’s most popular horror franchise go after A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 3: THE DREAM WARRIORS (aka the greatest sequel of all time)? Easy! It’s called A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 4: THE DREAM MASTER! This stylish head trip captures Freddy Krueger's transformation from a terrifying child murderer to a cuddly stand-up comic. Some people have a problem with that, but we don't. Because this is an outrageous fun bomb that explodes with stunning practical effects, a pizza with Freddy’s face on it, and a demonic dog named Jason who urinates a stream of fire. We should all cherish the fact that there was a time in history when THE DREAM MASTER could become the number-one movie in America. (Joseph A. Ziemba)

eventType.title: Special Event

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Cloverfield
show.headline: The found footage annihilator in 35mm.

event.title: <show-title>Cloverfield</show-title>
event.headline: The found footage annihilator in 35mm
event.description:
Arriving at the exact moment before social media annihilated everyone's brains, CLOVERFIELD is the viral sensation from mega-producer J.J. Abrams and director Matt Reeves (THE BATMAN) that reinvigorated found footage horror...again. The story follows a group of partying twenty-somethings (most notably Lizzy Caplan from PARTY DOWN) as they navigate the attacks of a giant beast in New York City. One of the great kaiju – or kaiju-adjacent, should you follow the right subreddit – films of the 21st century, CLOVERFIELD is back on the big screen the way it was meant to be seen: in a gorgeous 35mm print that was blown up from digital video.

Screening an archival 35mm print

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Hellraiser III: Hell on Earth
show.headline: What started in Hell will end on Earth

event.title: <show-title>Hellraiser III: Hell on Earth</show-title>
event.headline: Pinhead's revenge party
event.description:
We have such sights to show you...again. Executive produced by series creator Clive Barker and directed by Anthony Hickox (WAXWORK), HELLRAISER III: HELL ON EARTH is a supremely ‘90s explosion of gothic horror opulence. This sequel retains everything we love about the HELLRAISER franchise (surrealist visuals, cosmic kinks, buckets of gloop) while leaning far more into what we’ve always wanted: unhinged carnage from Pinhead and his cenobite friends. This includes many deaths via compact disc. If there was ever a movie that earned its Motörhead theme song, it’s this one.

Screening the 4K restoration

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Poltergeist (1982)
show.headline: PG-rated horror has never been so scary.

event.title: <show-title>Poltergeist (1982)</show-title>
event.headline: Director Tobe Hooper and producer Steven Spielberg know what scares you
event.description:
"They're here!"

Forty years ago, Steven Spielberg harvested some of his unused ideas from a pre-E.T. alien invasion film about an ordinary family pitted against the unknown, added in some supernatural elements from his darkest fears, and hired Tobe Hooper to direct. The result is the all-time American horror classic, POLTERGEIST - screening via a gorgeous new 4K restoration courtesy of Warner Brothers.

JoBeth Williams and Craig T. Nelson star as the Freelings, whose average suburban family is tested when unexplained phenomena begin to manifest in their house. What begins as curiosity turns to terror when their young daughter (played wonderfully by Heather O'Rourke) goes missing. Together, the family must rally their strength to rescue the child from the demonic entity preying upon their home.

Don't miss a 40th anniversary screening of one of the greatest ghost movies ever made. There's a reason this movie is a classic, folks.

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Silver Bullet
show.headline: When darkness falls, terror rises

event.title: <show-title>Silver Bullet</show-title>
event.headline: Don't miss this werewolf classic, screening along with a graphic novel signing
event.description:
WHERE WOLF – a new creator-owned graphic novel from creative team Rob Saucedo, Debora Lancianese, and Jack Morelli – is set in the wild world of furry conventions, small-town Texas journalism, and werewolf whodunit.

Leading up to the wide release of the book, writer and Graveyard Shift programmer Rob Saucedo will tour movie theaters across the country, screening werewolf films and providing an opportunity to purchase the graphic novel early at concurrent signing events.

In WHERE WOLF, something scary stalks the streets of Texas, leaving a trail of corpses in its wake. The only person standing in its way is Larry Chaney, a slacker reporter who can’t hold a job, can’t keep a girlfriend, and can’t stop getting in the way of his own career. Larry must go undercover at a local furry convention if he has any hope of stopping the beast dead set on turning the gathered attendees into an all-you-can-eat buffet. The graphic novel is a love letter to werewolf fans, with an irreverent bent that takes decades of lycanthropic lore to new heights and surprising places.

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
WHERE WOLF - a new creator-owned graphic novel from creative team Rob Saucedo, Debora Lancianese and Jack Morelli - is set in the wild world of furry conventions, small-town Texas journalism and werewolf whodunit.

Leading up to the wide release of the book, writer and Graveyard Shift programmer Rob Saucedo will tour movie theaters across the country - screening werewolf films and providing an opportunity to purchase the graphic novel early at concurrent signing events.

In WHERE WOLF, something scary stalks the streets of Texas, leaving a trail of corpses in its wake. The only person standing in its way is Larry Chaney, a slacker reporter who can’t hold a job, can’t keep a girlfriend, and can’t stop getting in the way of his own career. Larry must go undercover at a local furry convention if he has any hope of stopping the beast dead set on turning the gathered attendees into an all-you-can-eat buffet. The graphic novel is a love letter to werewolf fans, with an irreverent bent that takes decades of lycanthropic lore to new heights and surprising places.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Spawn
show.headline: Born in darkness. Sworn to justice.

event.title: <show-title>Spawn</show-title>
event.headline: Born in darkness. Sworn to justice.
event.description: Al Simmons (Michael Jai White) is an elite commando who is murdered by corrupt government agent Jason Wynn (Martin Sheen). But Satan has other plans – namely, he transforms Simmons into the zombie hell-revenger known as Spawn! Based on Todd McFarlane’s groundbreaking comic book, SPAWN is an inspired action-horror spectacle that’s unlike anything you’ve ever seen. Notable for featuring White as the first major African-American comic book superhero on the big screen, SPAWN is also a synapse-blasting explosion of H.P. Lovecraft-inspired monstrosities and a Gothic atmosphere that would make Clive Barker proud. (This includes John Leguizamo’s performance as a nightmarish, toxic filth-spewing clown named...Clown.)

show.title: Action Jackson
show.headline: It's time for "Action!"

event.title: <show-title>Action Jackson</show-title>
event.headline: Lights, camera, ACTION JACKSON!
event.description: Carl Weathers is "JACKSON!" in ACTION JACKSON, an outlandish, one-liner-filled late '80s piece of genre cinema that more than lives up to its title. Directed by I COME IN PEACE and STONE COLD director Craig R. Baxley, who piles on the practical stunts and pyrotechnics, and filled to the brim with character actors galore, ACTION JACKSON is an underrated '80s action gem that belongs in the canon alongside LETHAL WEAPON, PREDATOR, and BEVERLY HILLS COP.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Bloodsport
show.headline: Witness the awesome might of the Muscles from Brussels!

event.title: <show-title>Bloodsport</show-title>
event.headline: Witness the awesome might of the Muscles from Brussels!
event.description:
Prepare to have tufts of hair spontaneously explode all over your body and your goosebumps ripple into the manliest muscles you've ever seen as you witness the Muscles from Brussels roundhouse kick his way into your heart.

Jean-Claude Van Damme stars as real-life martial artist and frequent split-doer Frank Dux in the debatably true story of his time deserting the military to pursue his dreams of competing in the underground martial arts tournament, the Kumite, where pulses pound, bones shatter, and roundhouses are delivered in stylish slow-motion.

Van Damme dazzles as he fights his way to the top to square off against the epically brutal Kumite champ Chong Li (Bolo Yeung). Nothing can prepare you for the epic tale of Van Damme's first starring role that catapulted him to international stardom. Van Damme doesn't waste a single second of his screentime as a marvel of movement who kicks, punches, splits, and smashes bricks with his bare hands as he delivers 90 pulse-pounding white-knuckle minutes of pure VAN DAMMAGE!

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: D.E.B.S.
show.headline: The lovingly queer spy adventure of your dreams

event.title: <show-title>D.E.B.S.</show-title>
event.headline: The lovingly queer spy adventure of your dreams
event.description:
The year is 2004. Your dad is a Republican. The razorblades that are your emaciated hipbones saw through your super low rise jeans with every step. You own a lot of stuff that is colored powder blue and silver, like, just A LOT.

In comes D.E.B.S. D.E.B.S. is the spiritual spawn of the extreme femme-ness of the first season of The L Word and a Disney Channel Original Movie.

In a universe where everyone is actually really, really nice — including international crime lords and nationalist super spies – you get to see Jordana Brewster from The Fast & Furious series match wits with a woman who looks just like every popular girl I went to high school with.

This movie is Buffy-sploitation at its finest. We love to see roundhouse kicks in heels, we love for Powerpuff Girls to go gay, and we love to see Holland Taylor be the dean of a school of super hot young super spies.

So harken back to the days when people were commonly named things like “Scoot” and “Scud.” Put on a non-functional scarf as an accessory. Get ready to be a little fast and curious. I think you’ll really like D.E.B.S. (Natalie St. Clair)

35mm print courtesy of Sony Pictures Repertory.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Mars Attacks!
show.headline: Tim Burton's star-studded alien invasion comedy

event.title: <show-title>Mars Attacks!</show-title>
event.headline: Chaos reigns in Tim Burton’s retro-kitsch disaster jam, in 35mm
event.description:
How do you follow the success of gargantuan blockbusters like BATMAN and BATMAN RETURNS? Well, if you’re oddball director Tim Burton, you decide to make a campy, violent, big-budget alien invasion comedy based on a series of sci-fi trading cards from the 1960s.

With an absurdly star-studded cast, including Pierce Brosnan, Glenn Close, Annette Bening, Danny DeVito, Michael J. Fox, Martin Short, Natalie Portman, Jack Black, Sarah Jessica Parker's head on a chihuahua’s body, and Jack Nicholson in two different roles, MARS ATTACKS! is a demented piece of retro-pop madness that represents Tim Burton at his very best. If you've never seen this epic, raucously funny cult classic, don't miss your chance to experience it on the big screen.

show.title: Shaolin Invincibles
show.headline: Kung fu gorillas. Evil wizards with giant tongues. This is dumb fun.

event.title: <show-title>Shaolin Invincibles</show-title>
event.headline: Taiwanese martial arts from another dimension
event.description:
Two sword-wielding sisters seek revenge against the villains who murdered their family. But these are no ordinary villains – they’re wizards with giant, elasticized tongues who use black magic to control... kung fu gorillas! Starring the magnificent Judy Lee (QUEEN BOXER) and the fierce Carter Wong (BIG TROUBLE IN LITTLE CHINA), this supreme basher combines the electricity of a Super Nintendo game with exceptional fight choreography to deliver an otherworldly experience.

DCP via the American Genre Film Archive

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Voyage of the Rock Aliens
show.headline: A Greasy sci-fi 80s new wave rock musical

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Voyage of the rock aliens jimmy and the mustangs

portraitHeroImage.altText: Voyage of the rock aliens sp portrait

event.title: <show-title>Voyage of the Rock Aliens</show-title>
event.headline: A Greasy sci-fi 80s new wave rock musical
event.description:
"Highly recommend if you love 80s doing 50s but also Devo and also chainsaw murder subplots with a sub subplot about a toxic lake creature. PLUS GOOD MUSIC and a Jackson sibling (??). Everything you could ever want." - Alex T, Letterboxd

Devolution is real! This movie offers evidence that if you take the basic boy meets girl 50s sockhop and diners worshiping rock musical DNA of GREASE and put it through the Brundle transporter with Devo, the Rocky Horror Picture Show, a cheap Italian Star Wars knock-off, and a painfully unfunny Texas Chainsaw Massacre parody, you will end up with a devolved monster of a movie. Thankfully at Weird Wednesday we celebrate imperfection and appreciate mutants of all shapes and sizes. VOYAGE OF THE ROCK ALIENS is definitely an 80s rock musical, so come prepared to either suffer through or bop to Stray Cats rockabilly and dollar store Devo numbers, all are welcome. I think we can all agree it's kind of funny when androids have an orgasmic explosion (like, literally exploding) after flirting with a pretty girl though, right? In its own way, this is one of the strangest movies to escape from someone's brain and make it all the way to the silver screen. Warning: The entire first section of the movie is a Pia Zadora/Jermaine Jackson music video that has no bearing on anything that follows.

show.title: She's the Man
show.headline: Everybody has a secret...

event.title: <show-title>She's the Man</show-title>
event.headline: Raise some bubbly to the manliest high school movie ever
event.description:
We’re toasting one of the wildest teen comedies of the ‘00s with an effervescent screening where you can cheer, laugh, and enjoy a few glasses of the good stuff.

In many ways, SHE'S THE MAN follows in the grand tradition of late '90s teen comedies. It's based on a Shakespeare play (Twelfth Night), and it features a sprawling cast of generally attractive actors and an insane number of montages set to pop songs. The script was even co-written by the same team that brought us 10 THINGS I HATE ABOUT YOU and LEGALLY BLONDE.

But SHE'S THE MAN is far from your average high school movie, and much of that is due to an absolutely bonkers performance by Amanda Bynes as Viola, a girl pretending to be her brother so she can show the world that female soccer players are just as good as males. With cringe-worthy flailing and mind-blowing histrionics, Bynes is committed to her role in a way that is both hilarious and singularly strange. It wouldn't be surprising to find her as the subject of numerous dissertations on acting, because her turn as a girl cross-dressing as a boy is that fascinating.

SHE'S THE MAN also gave us the gift of Channing Tatum and his abs* in their first major big-screen appearance, and for that contribution alone, this film should be given the highest honors. We encourage you to swoon along with all of that Channing hotness and cheer along as Viola fights the patriarchy – because when it comes to (soccer) balls, she really is the man.

*In terms of comedic muscles, David Cross' turn as the school principal is criminally underrated.

show.title: Tales From The Crypt: Demon Knight
show.headline: Neon, slime, and hordes of hell-demons

event.title: <show-title>Tales From The Crypt: Demon Knight</show-title>
event.headline: Neon, slime, and hordes of hell-demons
event.description: Welcome the most joyful, outrageous, and gloopiest terrorblast of the 1990s. A full-length version of the legendary TALES FROM THE CRYPT television show on steroids, DEMON KNIGHT follows mysterious drifter Brayker (William Sadler) and spitfire Jeryline (Jada Pinkett-Smith) as they hold off an army of beasties under the command of The Collector (Billy Zane). Directed by the mighty Ernest Dickerson (cinematographer on Spike Lee’s DO THE RIGHT THING) and overflowing with phenomenal creature effects, this is a living comic book that demands to be experienced on the big screen.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: For all ages shows, we welcome babies and kids of all ages. The no talking rules are relaxed, since kids will be kids. But other than that, you can expect the full Alamo experience.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.title: 2D Digital
formats.headline: Digital format projected using a digital projector.
formats.description: Digital format projected using a digital projector.

formats.title: 3D Digital
formats.headline: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!
formats.description: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!

formats.title: 35mm
formats.headline: Film print projected using film projectors.
formats.description: The industry standard for theatrical film releases prior to digital cinema. Film print projected using film projectors.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages will be allowed at all screenings of this show.

agePolicies.name: Rated G
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG-13 (Standard)
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG with Adult Focus
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated R
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
